column4: johto: is there a channel particularly dedicated to using ubuntu's open office programs?
can anyone tell me how to convert an ubuntu open office document (flyer) to jpeg, for printing and for web publishing?
can anyone tell me how to convert an ubuntu open office document (flyer) to jpeg, for printing and for web publishing?
you can print it without converting it to jpeg. why not use the PDF export button? PDFs are easy to print and perfect for the web
guess i need to check if craigslist will take pdf
you could do a screenshot (alt+printscreen) and convert it to jpg with GIMP
i don't understand; you mean (alt + P)?
beware, all files except photos will look blurry in jpg format. no, the Prt Scr button
omg, that's the first time i ever SAW that button ... lol
ok, so what's the best format to preserve resolution/continuity?
best format would be Open Document Format. in descending order: HTML, PDF, PNG, GIF, JPEG
so do a file--->export to opendoc, from html to jpeg, whichever works for me?

this was my first time using open office, as soon as i figure all these things out i already love it.  Tell me, i prolly could have done the whole thing in GIMP, also, right?  just a picture with superimposed text ...?
well GIMP is nice and can solve most problems, but i don't think it can read the Open Document Format
my question is, couldn't i have done the whole project with gimp INSTEAD of openoffice?
ofcourse, whatever suits your needs. also, Scribus is great for desktop publishing (flyers etc)
ya, gotta familiarize myself with all of them.  well, thanks again for your help, gonna go back to work on it.
